1.title: Marking the Strangers
1.plot: The populist "Go Bekkebakken" political party have won the election,and our gang are worried what this will mean for Strangers in their home town. Already, there are changes at school. But where is Lars?

2.title: I am a Stranger
2.plot: While searching for Lars, Anna is forced to lie to her parents. Tess' family warn her to keep a low profile now that things have become uncertain for Strangers. A choice Robert makes has far reaching consequences - and not only for him.

3.title: Better off Dead
3.plot: Tess helps principal Torill tackle the recent chaos at school. Anna finally finds Lars, but things don't go quite as she had hoped.

4.title: Sorry
4.plot: Lars realizes he has been insensitive towards Anna lately, and tries to make it up to her. In the meantime, Anna struggles with the guilt of deceiving her parents. Tess dreads having to explain herself at home for not being able to keep her cool at school.

5.title: The Gym Show
5.plot: Anna must face the consequences of the lies she's been telling at home. The gang tries to help her before it's too late. The conflict between Caroline and Torill reaches new heights.

6.title: Troll in a Cage
6.plot: While the gang are re-playing the highlights of Anna's infamous performance, they get a surprise visit. We learn a more about what Trolls can do, and Lars has an idea of how to help Caroline.

7.title: Rebellion
7.plot: Anna and Lars are still trying to figure things out. Caroline has a life changing choice to make.

8.title: Into the Woods
8.plot: Our gang tries to work out what happened to Caroline. Torill decides enough is enough and attempts to split up the gang once and for all.

9.title: Crete
9.plot: While searching for Caroline, the gang meets Lisa who invites them home to stay the night. But is there something a little odd about Lisa and her family?

10.title: Heavy Metal
10.plot: Caroline has a surprise encounter that gives her a new direction - in more ways than one. Our gang have an unexpected encounter of their own when they come to the rescue of someone familiar in the woods.

11.title: Troll
11.plot: Caroline finds her father, but things are not as she imagined. A big secret is revealed.

12.title: Everyone Must Pull Themselves Together
12.plot: Back in Bekkebakken, our gang thinks life is going to be much better now. But in fact things take a turn for the worse. Lars makes a tough decision but must find the strength to see it through.

13.title: Letter to Fredrik
13.plot: A new alliance has been forged at Bekkebakken School, bringing with it significant changes. But is the battle really over?

1.title: Only Zombie in Town
1.plot: Lars is 11 years old and half zombie, or politically correctly "living - unliving". When Lars arrives in his new hometown of Bekkebakken he soon discovers that 'strangers' like himself are not as welcome as he'd hoped.

2.title: The Stranger Haters
2.plot: Lars has only just arrived, but is already set to leave Bekkebakken and run away to Detroit. On his way out of town he meets the mysterious Anna. Together with their new friend Robert, they discover that there are sinister powers that want to get rid of all who are different from Bekkebakken. Will Lars stay and fight?

3.title: The Bag Pooper
3.plot: Something nasty turns up in Julie's bag and Anna gets the blame. The School Principle believes that Lars is a bad influence on Anna and forbids her to hang out with him. Lars, Anna and Robert learn that there are other strangers in Bekkebakken.

4.title: The Witch
4.plot: Lars, Anna and Robert suspect that Tess is not the happy-go- lucky, 'good girl' that everyone believes she is. They decide to find out if she is in fact a witch. Lars finds himself beginning to feel strangely unwell every time he is near Anna.

5.title: Zombie Flu
5.plot: Lars is sick, which is the last thing he thought could happen to a "living-unliving". His mother, Erle, is worried and calls in the zombie doctor to find out if the symptoms are serious.

6.title: Fredrik
6.plot: An old friend of Lars's turns up unexpectedly in Bekkebakken and stirs things up when he decides to provoke the 'stranger haters' at the local gas station café. In the process Lars learns more about himself and Tess shows her true colours.

7.title: Before The Show
7.plot: Robert's father, a musician, will be performing at the local community center and the whole gang is invited. But 'parent trouble' seems to be the order of the day and as Lars tries to collect his friends on the way to the gig he learns a few home truths.

8.title: Throw out the Trash
8.plot: The concert at the community center does not go as expected. The gang realizes that the CAES have a wider reach than they could have imagined. Robert confronts his father.

9.title: Witches' Brew
9.plot: Tess is tasked with her witch grandmother's shopping list and in turn learns her family secret. Lars drinks a witches' brew with unexpected consequences.

10.title: The Morning After
10.plot: Once the effects of the witches' brew have worn off, both Lars and Tess feel they have some big choices to make. However not everyone in the gang agrees with their decisions.

11.title: The Gnome
11.plot: The school principle, Torill, is being pressured by the CAES to do something about the 'strangers' attending school. She sends our gang on litter picking duty to the gas station - a dangerous place for young strangers to find themselves alone.

12.title: Invisible Anna
12.plot: Anna strives to become visible after Lars has said he is in love with her. While Lars, on the other hand is afraid his declaration will change things between them and wonders what he could do to turn everything back to the way it was before.

13.title: Herman and Caroline
13.plot: The School Principal's children, Herman and Caroline, follow our gang and find their secret bus in the woods. Tess is furious, worried about the consequences and imminent betrayal. However, it soon becomes apparent that all is not what it seems with Herman and Caroline.

1.title: Uncle Adolf
1.plot: Our gang is back together again. They work out how Anna can gain control of her invisibility, allowing her to disappear at will. At first it seems like a fun game, but things turn serious when members of the dangerous anti-Stranger group CAES (Coalition Against Everything Strange) show up unexpectedly at Principal Torill's. Her children Caroline and Herman feel their mum is watching their every move.

2.title: Anna Abuses Her Powers
2.plot: When Lars tells Anna that Caroline has invited him home to help with her maths homework, Anna becomes jealous. Tess is convinced it's an excuse for a date. In her frustration, Anna does exactly what her father has told her not to; She takes advantage of her invisibility powers to spy on Lars and Caroline - with some highly unexpected results.

3.title: New Zombie In Town
3.plot: Are there any other living unliving in Bekkebakken who no one knows about? Lars suspects his classmate Michael is really a living unliving like himself, but when Lars confronts him, Michael vehemently denies it. Lars is convinced he's right even if none of his friends believe him, so he plans to find out the truth. However, what he learns turns out not be quite what he was hoping for.

4.title: Lars Goes Missing
4.plot: Principal Torill is frustrated because Michael was a living unliving boy with the ability to "pull himself together" and blend in. Since Lars outed him, she is even more angry with Lars and asks the CAES to take control of the situation. Lars promptly disappears. The rest of the gang enlist the help of a Dog Man to find him. Dog People are Strangers with great respect for authority, who are also excellent trackers.

5.title: Sabotage
5.plot: Having discovered the wealth of information that the CAES has gathered about Strangers living in Bekkebakken, our gang fears it will be used to get rid of them all. The CAES knows everything about our gang and their families. The gang devise a plan to break into the CAES headquarters and destroy the entire archive, but there are many obstacles to overcome if their mission is to be successful.

6.title: Lars Visits His Father
6.plot: Lars has discovered new information about his father. He now knows his name, where he lives and where he works. Feeling himself an outsider in Bekkebakken, Lars wants to contact his father and ask if he can move in with him. The rest of our gang, and especially Anna, become very disappointed in him. Does he really want to go and live with a father who has never contacted him, rather than stay in Bekkebakken with his best friends?

7.title: Torill's Waffles
7.plot: The big maths test is approaching that will determine if Bekkebakken School will rank as the country's best school of the year. Torill therefore organizes extra tuition for those who struggle with maths. This includes both Robert, and Tess - who has decided not to be a "good girl" at school anymore. Torill is in good spirits and serves waffles at the tutorials - the atmosphere is happy and upbeat. What's come over Torill? Tess not only uncovers the mystery, but also learns something about what it means to be a witch.

8.title: Fiona
8.plot: Tess believes her big sister, Ninni, hates her. So she is surprised when one night, Ninni showers her with compliments and suggests they hang out. Tess is really happy about Ninni's change of attitude. But the next morning, Ninni seems to have forgotten what she said the night before and is back to her quarrelsome self. Do the empty bottles of witches' brew under the bed have anything to do with Ninni's strange behaviour? It's time for Tess to show that she is the toughest witch in Bekkebakken.

9.title: Irene The Siren
9.plot: Classmate Irene asks Robert for help to fix her computer. She has heard he's very good at such things. Robert is very flattered and, of course, offers his assistance. The rest of our gang grow suspicious. Irene has had several boyfriends at school already. Does she have another agenda? Robert is offended by the accusation. He is also well on his way to falling in love with this wonderful girl. But isn't there something a little strange about her?

10.title: Half Angel. Dead Bird
10.plot: Kai, Robert's father, is sad because it's the birthday of Robert's mother who passed away a while ago. Lars goes with Robert to visit her grave. Whilst there they meet several people who claim Robert's mother was an angel. Does this mean that Robert is actually half angel? Tess and Anna are on the bus when a bird flies into the side window and injures itself. They decide it's better to kill it than to let it suffer, but cannot agree on who should do the deed.

11.title: Strangers' Legion
11.plot: "The Cultural Schoolbag", the Ministry of Education's arts and culture programme for schools, comes to Bekkebakken School to give a performance. In secret, one of the actors from TCS slip Lars a note with a time and place to meet. Are these actors really who they say they are? Does the gang dare to find out?

12.title: The Joker
12.plot: Anna is a ninja, and ninjas notice when someone is watching them. Recently, Anna has discovered that someone is spying on her. It turns out to be a boy of about her age named Tore. He claims he's a type of Stranger called a Joker. He seems nice and straightforward at first, but do jokers have a hidden side? What can jokers really do, and can we trust that anything Tore says is true?

13.title: The Election
13.plot: It's election time. One of the candidates for mayor of Bekkebakken is newcomer Bastian Berg from the "Heia Bekkebakken" coalition, who have ties to the CAES. Bastian promises free tacos every Friday, free waffles every Sunday and that all Strangers are to be kicked out of town. Will anyone vote for this? Are things about to change for the worse in Bekkebakken? And what will this mean for Anna and Lars?

imdb.plot outline: ZombieLars is an exciting drama comedy series for kids 8-12. Lars is eleven years old and a half zombie, or "living unliving" as the politically correct term goes. In his new hometown, Lars's kind are rare and frowned upon. But, he soon discovers others who are different too: a ninja, a witch, a troll and a changeling, to mention some. Together, they explore their true nature in a conformist and deeply prejudiced society. Will Lars' half dead heart start beating for someone special?
imdb.title: ZombieLars
plot: _ZombieLars_ (qv) is an exciting drama comedy series for kids 8-12. Lars is eleven years old and a half zombie, or "living unliving" as the politically correct term goes. In his new hometown, Lars's kind are rare and frowned upon. But, he soon discovers others who are different too: a ninja, a witch, a troll and a changeling, to mention some. Together, they explore their true nature in a conformist and deeply prejudiced society. Will Lars' half dead heart start beating for someone special?::Tordenfilm

runtime: 3 hr 17 min (197 min) (1. season) (total run time) (Finland)
